title: Piwik Marketplace (upload Plugin) not possible without internet
body:
Currently the Marketplace GUI to upload new plugins can only be accessed, if the server has correct internet access. If the installation is based behind a corporate proxy the marketplace request fails with an curl_exec error like
```
curl_exec: Could not resolve host: plugins.piwik.org. Hostname requested was: plugins.piwik.org
```
So it is not possible to access the upload plugin form without internet. I think the missing internet exceptions should be handled gracefully so the superadmin is still able to upload plugins via the web gui (without having shell access)

title: session_start() issue

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
Hi, I am using an auto-prepend script which requires sessions for proper operation.
This conflicts with Piwik, which also tries to start own session, generating notices with each request, filling up the logs quickly (and most importantly, can't log in or access reports).

My question is how hard would it be to implement a simple logic that checks if the session already exists, e.g.:

`if(!isset($_SESSION)) session_start();`

I have read many older topics, and I am aware of the alternative to store sessions into db, which I do not really want. I wonder why is this so hard to implement - do you have a particular reason for it?

Thanks

title: MediaAnalytics plugin causes much higher memory use

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
I'm not sure if this really warrants an issue, but I wanted to let you know of our experience with the MediaAnalytics plugin: after installing it in Piwik 2.17.1, reports would not load any more when selecting date ranges longer than a couple of months (custom date range). The site we tested this with has about 1 mio page views a month, but no media analytics events tracked yet.

PHP memory_limit was set to 128MB and was exhausted. When disabling the plugin, everything worked fine again. Increasing the limit to 512MB also solved the issue. So this isn't really a problem, but I was just astonished that just enabling a plugin that doesn't really have any data to be processed would increase the memory usage by that much.

title: Trying to install piwik on synology diskstation

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
Hello,

I am trying to install piwik on synology. i get this message:

504 There is an error while processing this request.

This message i got when i clicked install in the installation procesdure that comes up clicked the red button.

Before i got to this step i got this message:

An error occurred

Piwik couldn't write to some directories (running as user 'http').

Try to Execute the following commands on your server, to allow Write access on these directories:

chown -R http:www-data /volume1/web/piwik
chmod -R 0755 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp
chmod -R 0755 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/assets
chmod -R 0755 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/cache
chmod -R 0755 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/logs
chmod -R 0755 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/tcpdf
chmod -R 0755 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/templates_c
If this doesn't work, you can try to create the directories with your FTP software, and set the CHMOD to 0755 (or 0777 if 0755 is not enough). To do so with your FTP software, right click on the directories then click permissions.

After applying the modifications, you can refresh the page.

If you need more help, try Piwik.org.

at this point i logged into the DSM, diskstation using ssh and did chown and chmod. But it was not possible to do www-data so i did the following commands:

chown -R http:http /volume1/web/piwik
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/assets
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/cache
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/logs
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/tcpdf
chmod -R 0777 /volume1/web/piwik/tmp/templates_c

It was after that i had done the above commands that i got to the installation screen with the 8 steps but when i clicked the red button to do the first step then it broke down and i ended up at:

504 There is an error while processing this request.

So i couldnt do step two in the installation procedure. Please help me and show me how i am going to get through the installation procedure.

My operating system is (when i type uname -a):

Linux cross 3.2.40 #15047 Tue Feb 14 02:38:20 CST 2017 armv7l GNU/Linux synology_armada370_216se

Please tell me how to get a head or give me some advice on possible things i can do to install piwik manually on my diskstation.

I should also say that i have apache http server 2.2 and php 5.6 installed and running on a virtual server pointing to the folder of piwik.

So what happens is i get to the installation screen with the 8 steps but then when i click the red next button to get to the system check there is a long wait and then i get the 504 error. 

Regards Mattias

title: Add Twilio SMSProvider

labels.name: Needs Review
labels.description: For pull requests that need a code review.

body:
This branch adds a new SMS provider for Twilio. It is just two files, an image and `Twilio.php`, which is modelled after the existing SMS providers, `Clockwork.php` and `ASPSMS.php`.

The only SMSProvider method that I was unable to implement is `getCreditLeft()` because the Twilio API does not provide a way to check your current account balance.

title: Fix Overlay bubbles on Firefox (and Opera Mini)

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: For errors / faults / flaws.

body:
The previous css [didn't work on firefox](http://caniuse.com/#search=zoom). Using `transform: scale()` combined with `transform-origin` is the recommended way to do it. 

This also makes the placement of bubbles more consistent, makes it so we do not need to adjust offset `top`/`left` for `zoomFactor`.

title: Add possibility to select a specific frame within a page

labels.name: Needs Review
labels.description: For pull requests that need a code review.

body:
eg `page.selectFrame('myFrameName');` and at the end of the test `page.selectMainFrame();`

What doesn't seem to work yet correctly is typing within the frame. I presume the position where the click should happen is not calculated correctly (it clicks before sending keys).

title: New event that lets plugins trigger notifications in the admin area

labels.name: Needs Review
labels.description: For pull requests that need a code review.

body:
They have to be triggered before assigning the notifications to the view and there is no other way to determine when a plugin is supposed to trigger notifications in the admin. Ideally, in the future we would even move the notifications above to CoreAdminHome or somewhere else eventually.

First thought of using `Controller.addAdminNotifications` as we often use this wording but then we would need to rather do `Piwik::postEvent('Controller.triggerAdminNotifications', &$notifications);` as otherwise nothing can be added.

Plugins could actually also use this event to cancel notifications where in the past it was needed to hide them via CSS. 

Happy about any other naming suggestions but want to keep it "specific" to notifications and not something to general like `postEvent('Controller.renderAdminView, $view')`.

title: Piwik v2.17.1 unable to install plugin that have version for v2 and v3 via the Marketplace interface

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: For errors / faults / flaws.

labels.name: c: Marketplace
labels.description: For issues that affect the Matomo Plugin Marketplace where you can download plugins.

body:
Hello,

We have a Piwik v2.17.1 running, in which we wanted to install the MediaAnalytics plugin.

When we go on the web marketplace, we can see that there is a version for [Piwik v2](https://plugins.piwik.org/MediaAnalytics?piwikversion=2) (the v2.0.5), and one for [Piwik v3](https://plugins.piwik.org/MediaAnalytics?piwikversion=3) (the v3.0.4).

But when I go to the Marketplace interface in Piwik, I am unable to install the plugin as it only shows the v3.0.4.

My expectation would be that Piwik v2 will allow downloading the version working with it, and not only the very last version of the plugin.

I stay available for any information you would like to have, or missing from the previous description.

title: Curl_exec: SSL: invalid CA certificate #1 (offset 0) in bundle

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

body:
It's basically a mac os x or unix problem.

`$ php -i | grep "SSL Version"`

I suspect you'll see this:
`SSL Version => SecureTransport`

And that's the problem. OS X is using SecureTransport and NOT OpenSSL.
Simple solution: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26461966/osx-10-10-curl-post-to-https-url-gives-sslread-error2

So or follow these steps (not complicated If you do a bit more with your osx) or Piwik has to add SecureTransport.

title: Users always get Error: Wrong Username and password combination.

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
Whenever a user tries to log in, they always get Error: Wrong Username and password combination. Updating the password works (I get the e-mail and after clicking the link, the password hash is changed in the DB) but I still get the same error.

I've been experimenting a bit and when I return a forced TRUE in Auth::hasSuperUserAccess() and Auth::wasAuthenticationSuccessful() (core/auth.php) I can login but then I get another error:
You can't access this resource as it requires an view access for at least one website.

So maybe user rights are screwed up? As a superuser, I shouldn't be bothered with individuals site view rights.

I've removed all files (except for the config folder) and uploaded the latest version twice, this doesn't fix the issue.

Any tips or things I can try?

title: Add system check for the hash() php function

labels.name: Help wanted
labels.description: Beginner friendly issues

labels.name: not-in-changelog
labels.description: For issues or pull requests that should not be included in our release changelog on matomo.org.

body:
Error reported by email:

> Fatal error: Call to undefined function hash() in ....../vendor/twig/twig/lib/Twig/Environment.php on line 331

To prevent this error let's add a system check for the hash() function.

`hash()` is enabled by default in PHP but it can be disabled when php is compiled with `--disable-hash`.

title: Same IP (server host ip) for all visitors when using tracker-proxy

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
For some websites I am using piwik tracker proxy (https://github.com/piwik/tracker-proxy), but in Visitors in Real Time widget every user has the same IP address, the address of the web server IP. There are no other proxy-s involved.

The tracker proxy does a request to real piwik tracker like this one:
`91.X.Y.Z - - [02/Mar/2017:16:55:57 +0100] "GET /piwik.php?cip=212.A.B.C&token_auth=9c43c...`

91.X.Y.Z is the server IP, 212.A.B.C is clients real IP address.

So the tracker proxy sets the cip query parameter right, the correct IP is there. Still, the real piwik server do not obey to this, but uses the server host IP address.

If you need any more info let me know.

title: Upgrader does not delete files that were removed in a newer Piwik version

labels.name: Regression
labels.description: Indicates a feature used to work in a certain way but it no longer does even though it should.

body:
Today, I updated Piwik, as installed via Softaculous.
I had Piwik version 3.0.1, and upgraded to version 3.0.2

I went from this page: https://example.com/piwik/index.php?module=CoreUpdater&action=newVersionAvailable, and chose an automated update, which took me to this page: https://example.com/piwik/index.php?module=CoreUpdater&action=oneClickUpdate,
which reported:
> An error occurred
> Your Piwik version 3.0.2 is up to date.

However, I appear to now be running 3.0.2 just fine. I ran the System Check and the only thing I see is another file integrity check issue which may have been pre-existing:
> Files were found in your Piwik but we didn't expect them.
> --> Please delete these files to prevent errors. <--
> 
> File to delete: error_log
> File to delete: libs/jquery/jquery.smartbanner.js
> File to delete: libs/jquery/MIT-LICENSE-smartbanner.txt
> File to delete: libs/jquery/stylesheets/jquery.smartbanner.css

I'm not sure what the error message was about, but at the very least, this is a usability problem.

title: Fix typo in french localisation
body:
s/peut être/peut-être in some places.

This typo may be difficult to catch for non-native speakers.
"Peut-être" means "perhaps" (or "maybe"), while "peut être"
is the verbal form: "can be".

Please issue pull request against the `3.x-dev` branch only.

Piwik 2 is in LTS mode. This means we do not accept any pull request for 2.x except critical security bugs and major data loss bugs. 

If you need to create a pull request for 2.x, then please also create the pull request against the `3.x-dev` so we can merge both.

Happy hacking!

title: XHR widget requests

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
Currently all widgets are sending **XMLHttpRequests** independently. I think this sometimes impacting on server performance, especially on shared hosting.

What I'd suggest is to use **Promise** (https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise) and queue all widget requests. I think there is no need to "_attack_" server with multiple requests at the same time. Just send one and wait until it finishes then send another one.

Possibly, this could be even configured in Piwik options to send widget XHR requests asynchronously or synchronously.

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

body:
I'm running Piwik 3.0.1 (upgraded to 3.0.2 today) and just realized that my upgrade to MySQL 5.7 a couple of days ago started to prevent Piwik from logging visits. The errors are like this:

```
[Thu Mar 02 09:08:05.913094 2017] [:error] [pid 6312] [client 46.223.59.40:51104] Error in Piwik (tracker): Error query: SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1364 Field 'location_browser_lang' doesn't have a default value In query: INSERT INTO piwik_log_visit (idvisitor, config_id, location_ip, idsite, visit_first_action_time, visit_goal_buyer, visit_goal_converted, visit_last_action_time, visitor_days_since_first, visitor_days_since_order, visitor_returning, visitor_count_visits, visit_entry_idaction_name, visit_entry_idaction_url, visit_exit_idaction_name, visit_exit_idaction_url, visit_total_actions, visit_total_interactions, visit_total_searches, referer_keyword, referer_name, referer_type, referer_url, config_browser_engine, config_browser_name, config_browser_version, config_device_brand, config_device_model, config_device_type, config_os, config_os_version, visit_total_events, visitor_localtime, visitor_days_since_last, config_resolution, config_cookie, config_director, config_flash, config_gears, config_java, config_pdf, config_quicktime, config_realplayer, config_silverlight, config_windowsmedia, visit_total_time, location_country, location_provider) VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?) Parameters: array ( 0 => 'X\xa7i\x17\xcf\x04\x8a"', 1 => '\x14?\x1fA\xfd\x890#', 2 => '.\xdf;(', 3 => 1, 4 => '2017-03-02 08:08:05', 5 => 0, 6 => 0, 7 => '2017-03-02 08:08:05', 8 => '7', 9 => 0, 10 => 1, 11 => 5, 12 => 8988, 13 => 192, 14 => 8988, 15 => 192, 16 => 1, 17 => 1, 18 => 0, 19 => NULL, 20 => NULL, 21 => 1, 22 => 'https://www.paragon-es.de/contact', 23 => 'WebKit', 24 => 'SF', 25 => '10.0', 26 => '', 27 => '', 28 => 0, 29 => 'MAC', 30 => '10.12', 31 => 0, 32 => '09:08:05', 33 => '0', 34 => '2560x1440', 35 => 1, 36 => 0, 37 => 0, 38 => 0, 39 => 1, 40 => 1, 41 => 0, 42 => 0, 43 => 0, 44 => 0, 45 => 0, 46 => 'de', 47 => 'kabel-badenwuerttemberg.de', ), referer: https://www.paragon-es.de/imprint
```

I saw a few old issues about that topic and all are closed and state that the bugs are fixed. So I wonder why they are still present here. Has Piwik missed a db upgrade at one point here? If so, what can I do to fix this?

title: Release Piwik 3.0.3
body:
### Checklist for a successful release:
- [x] Beta release cycle has started with the first beta release!
- [x] Forum support: regularly check all posts in [Support & Bugs forum](http://forum.piwik.org/c/support-bugs)
- [x] Forum General questions: look for bugs & regressions in [General questions forum](http://forum.piwik.org/c/general-questions) 
- [x] Backlog grooming: [check issues without milestone](https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+no%3Amilestone) if any one should be fixed in this release 
- [x] Check [this list of issues across all Piwik repositories](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+org%3Apiwik+org%3Ainnocraft+milestone%3A%22Current+sprint%22+), where the milestone is set to `Current sprint` 
- [x] Make [CI builds](https://travis-ci.org/piwik/) of our official plugins `piwik/plugin-*` all green 
- [x] Tag a new release for `piwik/referrer-spam-blacklist` and `piwik/searchengine-and-social-list`
- [ ] Fetch our latest and greatest home-made libraries with `composer update piwik/referrer-spam-blacklist piwik/searchengine-and-social-list piwik/piwik-php-tracker piwik/component-network,piwik/component-ini,piwik/component-decompress,piwik/component-cache`
- [ ] Fetch the latest composer libraries for all with `composer update`
- [x] Up to date submodules
- [ ] Tag the RC candidate 
- [ ] Check that the build is green
- [x] [Package & release](https://github.com/piwik/piwik-package#core-piwik-package) the Release Candidate
- [ ] Post sticky thread in forum [about RC](http://forum.piwik.org/t/2-15-0-rc-release-your-feedback-is-important/16484), 
- [ ] inform RC release on social media 
- [ ] Release candidate cycle (at least 1 week cycle)
- [x] Fix all remaining issues in the milestone
- [ ] All open source plugins builds are green on `master` with latest RC
- [ ] Plugins that needed a version bump are now released on the marketplace.
- [x] Synchronise translations from transifex 
- [x] Up to date submodules
- [x] Prepare the [Changelog entry](http://piwik.org/changelog/) for the new release: 
 - [x] Mark that the release has a major DB upgrade
 - [x] Use [our github changelog generator](https://github.com/piwik/github-changelog-generator) to generate the changelog [using this `config.js`](https://github.com/piwik/github-changelog-generator#sample-configjs-file)
 - [x] Add to changelog any new issues or FAQ added since first RC
 - [x] Add to changelog the security issues fixed, if any
 - [x] Do not publish publicly the changelog yet. This also ensures security issues are not publicly visible until the stable release.
 - [x] Change changelog published date to the release day
- [x] For each issue in the changelog:
 - [x] is this issue relevant to developers? let's mention it in the [Developer changelog](http://developer.piwik.org/changelog)
 - [x] is this issue's title descriptive and useful to people scanning our changelog? 
 - [ ] are the right labels applied to the issue? (issues tagged with labels such as `Bug`, `Enhancement`, `Major` are grouped together in the changelog)
 - [ ] if this [issue was sponsored](https://piwik.org/development/), we note the sponsor organisation in the changelog.
- [x] Close milestone on Github
- [x] Release publicly the new stable version!
- [x] In Github release write 

```
## [Piwik XYZ Changelog](https://piwik.org/changelog/piwik-XYZ/)

This Github download (below) is only meant for developers and it will require extra work to install it. 
 commands data-understanding.ipynb drafts.json drafts.py ex.sh get_issues.py json2csv.py matomo17202.json matomo-org trial.ipynb Latest stable production release can be found at https://piwik.org/download/ ([learn more](https://piwik.org/docs/installation/)) (recommended)
 commands data-understanding.ipynb drafts.json drafts.py ex.sh get_issues.py json2csv.py matomo17202.json matomo-org trial.ipynb Beta and Release Candidates releases can be found at https://builds.piwik.org/ ([learn more](http://piwik.org/faq/how-to-update/faq_159/))

```
- [ ] Take screenshots of new features + draft a blog post showcasing what's new 
- [x] Create this 'Release Piwik 3.*' issue in the next release milestone

title: Tracking API: ensure that Visitor ID is the same across all visits of a given visitor and re-uses the last visitor id value set

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: For new feature suggestions that for example enhance Matomo's cabapilities..

milestone.title: Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: This is our backlog of issues. Help wanted!

body:
Follows up #2211 

In the Tracking API, How to ensure that a Visitor ID is the same across all visits of a given visitor?

For this we may need to re-use the latest visitor id value set during a visit, and update it in all the log_* tables for this visit. 

And possibly we would need to update the visitor ID in any previous visit as well?

This could be a complex issue to solve properly.

title: Optional secure tracker cookie

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

labels.name: Help wanted
labels.description: Beginner friendly issues

labels.name: c: Security
labels.description: For issues that make Matomo more secure. Please report issues through HackerOne and not in Github.

milestone.title: Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: This is our backlog of issues. Help wanted!

body:
I think this topic was discussed years ago, but I do get negativ security points via Mozillas observatory when delivering first party tracking cookies without the secure flag.

I think it should be possible to enable that plag on a per website basis. Most websites I setup are SSL only, a request to non encrypted pages gets redirected to ssl and that ist the recommended canonical url for every page. So I don't need any sharing of session tracking cookies between http and https.

title: Chrome Page unresponsive with date range + segments

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: For errors / faults / flaws.

labels.name: c: Performance
labels.description: For when we could improve the performance / speed of Matomo.

labels.name: c: Usability
labels.description: For issues that let users achieve a defined goal more effectively or efficiently.

milestone.title: Priority Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: Most important issues we should tackle next. If you can help: please join the discussion and/or issue a pull request ([help](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/contributing-to-piwik-core)).

body:
With pre-crunched reports, everything run smoothly but my Piwik installation has more than 130 milllion records so when using segments AND Date Range I often got the infamous "Page(s) unresponsive" in Chrome because Piwik is hard at work getting the data.

This kind of timeout doesn't seems to show up in Opera or recent Firefox. It looks like since Piwik isn't sending any data for a long time (3 minutes) Chrome got the impression nothing is happening and throw the "Unresponsive" box. 

Feature request: Send some stuff from the server to say "I'm still working, no worries" to browsers...

title: Record real device resolution and devicepixelratio

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: For new feature suggestions that for example enhance Matomo's cabapilities..

milestone.title: Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: This is our backlog of issues. Help wanted!

body:
I think it's really confusing if UHD devices like 4k monitors and smartphones get listed under visitor devices with the "wrong" resolution. As stated in #10296 it does make sense from a website point of view but in this way you can't differentiate between HiDPI devices and normal devices. E.g. it could be worth or necessary to provide images on a website with higher resolutions if more and more users with HiDPI displays are going to visit a website. With the current state this could not be tracked.

A solution could be to simply record both, the real screen resolution, which should also be presented under the device informations, and the "actual" resolution / viewport size.

I have PIWIK 3.0.1 version.

title: Visitor map (showing cities) Error: visitorId is expected to be a 16 hex char string

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

labels.name: Waiting for user feedback
labels.description: Indicates the Matomo team is waiting for feedback from the author or other users.

milestone.title: Priority Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: Most important issues we should tackle next. If you can help: please join the discussion and/or issue a pull request ([help](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/contributing-to-piwik-core)).

body:
**Description:**
When trying to open the visitor log (clicking on a circle corresponding to a given city from the visitor map panel) the error "Error: visitorId is expected to be a 16 hex char string" is shown

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Access a visitor map panel from a site containing pages with no ASCII characters in their title
2. Zoom in the map as far as you can switch the view to "Cities":
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25912392/23261012/c597fd70-f9d4-11e6-96c2-27aaa9cfc5f1.png)
3. Click on a circle to open the visitor log

**Gotten result:**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25912392/23260877/34ffee9e-f9d4-11e6-8ff3-35cd73fb47cb.png)

**Expected result:**
The visitor log opens as usually it does.

**Additional info:**
The visitor log opens correctly if accessed from the "Real time map" panel instead.

This can not be reproduced in other sites I have except those where page titles have non ASCII characters (like french ones: ^, ', ´, `,...) so I guess this could be related somehow with [Custom dashboards and visitor segments: The segment %s is not valid](https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/8323)

---

title: The parameter 'module' isn't set in the Request, and a default value wasn't provided.

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

body:
Since I have applied the patch of pull request #11358 I am experiencing a new bug. 

If I visit https://piwik.mydomain.example/ I get the following error:
> The parameter 'module' isn't set in the Request, and a default value wasn't provided.

![screenshot_20170222_101924](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/23204915/7db550bc-f8e8-11e6-885c-4b1bc993a8fe.png)

https://piwik.mydomain.example/index.php?module=CoreHome is working (shows the login form)

If I revert the patch, the bug vanishes, so it must have to do with the pull request (I assume this line: https://github.com/piwik/piwik/pull/11358/files#diff-719a15b635df457515639ff08ee921b3R711)

It's also visible in the UI tests of https://github.com/piwik/piwik/pull/11383#issuecomment-281379363

http://builds-artifacts.piwik.org/piwik/piwik/3.x-dev/22428/Login_login_form.png
